cp22:1.3: I was a loved and cherished child
cp22:2.1: I was ethical, full of good qualities,
cp22:2.4: and expert in the methods of inclusiveness.
cp22:3.1: Now there was this charlatan renunciant
cp22:3.2: who was favored by the king.
cp22:3.3: He made a living by cultivating
cp22:4.2: like a pile of chaff without grain,
cp22:4.4: like a plantain tree with no core, I thought:
cp22:5.3: He has left the bright qualities of conscience
cp22:5.4: for the sake of making a living.
cp22:6.3: Before going to put an end to it,
cp22:7.2: the matted-hair ascetic of severe penance.
cp22:7.3: He is the granter of our wishes,
cp22:8.1: I went then to serve him,
cp22:8.4: Is there anything I can bring for you?’
cp22:9.1: At that he was upset with me,
cp22:10.1: After putting an end to the border conflict,
cp22:10.2: the king said to the charlatan,
cp22:11.4: the Lord of the Earth commanded:
cp22:12.2: Saw his corpse into four pieces!
cp22:12.3: And then show them from street to street:
cp22:12.4: this is the fate of one who shames the ascetic.’
cp22:13.3: They dragged me from my mother’s lap
cp22:14.2: as they bound me with tight bonds:
cp22:14.3: ‘Present me to the king right now,
cp22:14.4: I have an issue for the king!’
cp22:15.1: They presented me to the king,
cp22:15.2: follower of the wicked one and his wicked ways.
cp22:15.3: On seeing me, I persuaded him
cp22:15.4: and brought him under my influence.
cp22:16.1: He asked for my forgiveness then,
cp22:16.3: But having burst the darkness asunder,
cp22:17.1: I did not dislike great kingship,
cp22:17.2: nor did I dislike sensual enjoyment.
cp22:17.3: But because omniscience is precious to me,
cp22:17.4: that is why I renounced kingship.”
